conversation.content: You probably don't remember me, but you worked for my father eight years ago. [pause] The Castellano job in Miami, the one where everything went sideways and you still got everyone out alive.
[coldly] I remember every job, especially the ones that nearly got me killed. [long pause] You were what, sixteen? Daddy's precious heir apparent, groomed since birth to take over the empire.
[bitter] Not anymore.

[curious] So the golden child finally grew a conscience? [laughs] Let me guess, you saw something you couldn't unsee, maybe realized all that blood money funding your Ivy League education had actual blood attached to it.

[shaky voice] Three weeks ago, my father ordered a hit on a prosecutor's family, including their twelve-year-old daughter. [quietly] I couldn't just stand by and watch him murder a child for leverage.
[stern] And now you've got a price on your head that would make most contract killers retire after one job. [sighs] Every professional in the country will be gunning for you by sunrise.
[desperately] That's why I need you. You know how they operate, their safe houses, their protocols. [pause] You're the only one who ever walked away from my father and lived.

Walking away and staying alive are two very different things, kid. [roughly] I've been looking over my shoulder for eight years, sleeping with one eye open, never staying anywhere longer than three months.

[frustrated] I have money, lots of it, hidden offshore accounts my father doesn't know about. [firmly] Whatever your rate is, I'll triple it, but I need someone who won't sell me out the moment things get complicated.

[mocking] Money? You think this is about money? [laughs bitterly] Your father owns judges, senators, entire police departments, and you want to throw cash at the problem like you're hiring a bodyguard for prom night.
Then what do you want? [anxiously] There has to be something, because if you were going to turn me in for the bounty, you would have done it the second I walked through that door.

[thoughtfully] Your father has something that belongs to me, something he took as insurance when I left his organization. [pause] A safety deposit box in Geneva with evidence that could destroy everything he's built.
[perceptive] The Kozlov recordings from the dock massacre. [quietly] He keeps them in his study safe, shows them off sometimes when he's drunk and feeling nostalgic about the old days.
[surprised] You've seen them?

[regretful] I've memorized the safe combination, know exactly when the house is most vulnerable, and which guards can be bought. [sighs] I spent my whole life preparing to inherit an empire I ultimately couldn't stomach.
[slowly] So we're talking about more than just running and hiding. [pause] You want to burn it all down on your way out, take down the whole operation while saving your own skin.

[firmly] I want to make sure that twelve-year-old girl and her family get to live their lives without looking over their shoulders. [passionate] If destroying my father's empire is what it takes, then yes, I want to watch it all burn.

[warmly] Now you're speaking my language, kid. [chuckles] Your old man always said you were soft, but I'm starting to think he mistook conscience for weakness, and that might just be his biggest mistake.
So you'll help me? Even knowing that every killer from here to the West Coast will be hunting us, that my father won't stop until we're both dead or worse?

[confidently] I've been waiting eight years for a shot at your father, and now his own flesh and blood walks into my safe house with inside information and a death wish. [laughs] Sometimes the universe delivers exactly what you need wrapped in exactly what you don't expect.

scenario: The privileged heir of a crime family seeks protection from a hired gun who once worked for their father, after betraying the family to save innocent lives.
